anl.verdi.loaders

Class SyntheticTimeAxis

  • java.lang.Object
    • anl.verdi.loaders.SyntheticTimeAxis
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    anl.verdi.data.CoordAxis, anl.verdi.data.TimeCoordAxis

    public class SyntheticTimeAxis
extends java.lang.Object
implements anl.verdi.data.TimeCoordAxis
    Creates a Time axis from an ordinate CoordAxis, assuming the units of that axis are "seconds since" some date.
    Version:
    $Revision$ $Date$
    Author:
    Nick Collier

    • Method Detail

      • getDate

        public java.util.GregorianCalendar getDate(int timestep)
        Returns the GregorianCalendar date for the specified timestep. If the we are unable to parse the time step axis sufficient to create a date then this returns null.
        Specified by:
        getDate in interface anl.verdi.data.TimeCoordAxis
        Parameters:
        timestep - the time step we want the date for.
        Returns:
        the GregorianCalendar date for the specified timestep, or null if there is no time axis, or null if unable to parse the time axis units.

      • getTimeStep

        public int getTimeStep(java.util.Date date)
        Gets the timestep that corresponds to the specified date. If no such timestep is found then return TIME_STEP_NOT_FOUND.
        Specified by:
        getTimeStep in interface anl.verdi.data.TimeCoordAxis
        Parameters:
        date - the date whose time step we want
        Returns:
        the timestep that corresponds to the specified date. If no such timestep is found then return TIME_STEP_NOT_FOUND.

      • getTimeStep

        public int getTimeStep(java.util.GregorianCalendar aCalendar)
        Gets the timestep that corresponds to the specified GregorianCalendar date. If no such timestep is found then return TIME_STEP_NOT_FOUND.
        Specified by:
        getTimeStep in interface anl.verdi.data.TimeCoordAxis
        Parameters:
        date - the GregorianCalendar (date) whose time step we want
        Returns:
        the timestep that corresponds to the specified date. If no such timestep is found then return TIME_STEP_NOT_FOUND.

      • isCompatible

        public boolean isCompatible(anl.verdi.data.CoordAxis axis)
        Gets whether or not the this axis is compatible with the specified axis. Two axes are compatible if they can be used together in the same formula.
        Specified by:
        isCompatible in interface anl.verdi.data.CoordAxis
        Parameters:
        axis - the axis to check for compatibility
        Returns:
        true if this axis is compatibility with the other axis, Otherwise false.
